intro: Didymocheton quercifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf sycamore, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that resemble those of oak trees, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae and is known for its stout, woody stems and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. It typically grows in lowland forests and thrives in humid, warm climates. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
